FuncDef:
The ds-lite statistics enable command enables a device to collect DS-Lite statistics.
The undo ds-lite statistics enable command disables a device from collecting DS-Lite statistics.
This function is disabled by default.
CLIs: ds-lite statistics { port-usage | session-usage | address-pool-usage } enable
undo ds-lite statistics { port-usage | session-usage | address-pool-usage } enable

ParaDef.Info:
Enables a device to collect or disables a device from collecting statistics about the average and maximum port usage in each instance.
-

Enables a device to collect or disables a device from collecting statistics about the average and maximum usage of IP addresses in an address pool.
-

Enables a device to collect or disables a device from collecting statistics about the average and maximum number of sessions in each instance.
-

ExtraInfo: A device can be enabled to collect DS-Lite statistics, including IP address usage of an address pool on the device and the number of ports used in each DS-Lite instance. To enable a device to collect DS-Lite statistics, run the ds-lite statistics enable command. The device samples statistics every 10 minutes by default. After the ds-lite statistics { port-usage | session-usage | address-pool-usage } enable command is run, the display nat statistics command can be run 10 minutes later to view statistics.
